translations.v: Oopsy! Ocorreu um erro em segundo plano! jogo agora pode estar instavel. Reinicie o jogo e ajude-nos ao reportar esse problema!
A madeira é um material de construçao básico. Também pode ser processada em carvao vegetal em um forno de carvao vegetal.
O refugo nao é apenas um material de construçao básico para edifícios. Também pode ser usado para fabricar ferramentas ou para processar recursos especiais

O metal pode ser recuperado da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. O metal é um material mais robusto, usado principalmente para ferramentas aprimoradas ou edifícios especiais.
O plástico pode ser recuperado da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. É um material essencial para conter a radiaçao.
É possível recuperar eletrônicos da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. Os eletrônicos sao usados ​​principalmente para a fonte de alimentaçao.
O pano pode ser recuperado da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. O pano é usado por um alfaiate para produzir roupas de proteçao.

A água é a chave para a sobrevivência. A água pode ser coletada dos lagos por um cais, do solo por um poço ou da chuva por um coletor de água da chuva. Uma Reservatórioa ou uma torre de água é necessária para distribuir a água dentro de um poço. o acordo
O fornecimento de uma ampla variedade de alimentos juntamente com ervas mantém seus colonos saudáveis ​​e reduz o risco de um surto de doença.
As frutas sao colhidas pelos coletores e podem ser encontradas nas florestas.
Os cogumelos sao colhidos pelos coletores e podem ser encontrados nas florestas.
As raízes sao desenterradas pelos coletores e podem ser encontradas nas florestas.
Javalis fornecem carne de javali quando sao mortos por um caçador.
Os veados fornecem Roe Venison se mortos por um caçador.
As ervas sao colhidas pelos coletores e podem ser encontradas nas florestas.
A cerveja é produzida na taberna e serve para alegrar o humor dos colonos
Uma ferramenta importante para concluir as tarefas de trabalho no ambiente circundante.
Uma ferramenta mais avançada e com maior durabilidade para executar tarefas de trabalho em todo o local.
O carvao é feito de madeira usando um forno a carvao. Ele pode ser usado em uma torre de água para purificar a água e remover a radiaçao.
Lenços de pescoço protegem os colonos contra radiaçao de baixo nível.
Máscaras de carvao ativado protegem os colonos contra radiaçao de nível médio.
Os trajes de radiaçao protegem os colonos contra radiaçao de alto nível.
O feijao pode ser colhido nos campos.
O repolho pode ser colhido nos campos.
O milho pode ser colhido nos campos.
Os pimentoes podem ser colhidos nos campos.
As batatas podem ser colhidas nos campos.
Abóboras gigantes podem ser colhidas nos campos.
A abóbora pode ser colhida nos campos.
O trigo pode ser colhido nos campos.
Maças podem ser colhidas em pomares.
As cerejas podem ser colhidas nos pomares
Pêssegos podem ser colhidos em pomares.
Peras podem ser colhidas em pomares.
Nozes-peca podem ser colhidas em pomares.
As ameixas podem ser colhidas nos pomares.
Nozes podem ser colhidas em pomares.
Os peixes podem ser capturados nas cabanas de pesca

O cânhamo pode ser colhido nos campos. Ao contrário de outras culturas, o cânhamo nao é uma fonte de alimento. O cânhamo é convertido em junçoes em um bar. Eles podem ser consumidos pelos colonos para aumentar sua confiança.
As juntas podem ser produzidas em uma taberna e consumidas pelos colonos para aumentar sua confiança.
O medicamento pode ser produzido em instalaçoes médicas.
Raçoes da Expediçao sao pacotes de Comida e Água com os quais as Expediçoes podem ser equipadas para explorar repetidamente Ruínas antes que a Expediçao precise retornar.
O licor duro pode ser produzido em uma taberna a partir de vários ingredientes.
Uma pequena cabana na qual os colonos podem viver e iniciar uma família. Os colonos só se mudam como uma família.

Uma cabana media na qual os colonos podem viver e começar uma família. Este edifício tem capacidade adicional para armazenar água e alimentos e pode suportar mais tempestades de areia. Os colonos só se mudam como uma família.
Um  grande cabana que pode abrigar um grande número de colonos, embora nao seja adequado para iniciar uma família.
Um caminho simples que permite aos colonos progredir rapidamente.
Uma estrada pavimentada que permite que os colonos progridam mais rapidamente.
Uma estrada pavimentada que permite que os colonos viajem mais rapidamente e possibilita a proteçao contra chuva tóxica.
Todos os tipos de recursos sao mantidos em um armazém. Este edifício nao pode armazenar água.
Um local para armazenar matérias-primas como madeira, sucata ou metal.
Um edifício central para distribuir todos os recursos no assentamento. Os logísticos coletam recursos nas imediaçoes do mercado.
Uma Estaçao de Expediçao envia Exploradores para coletar Recursos e objetos especiais em locais no mapa.
Um cemitério oferece aos colonos um lugar onde eles podem lamentar seus parentes falecidos, o que aumenta sua confiança.

O centro da cidade é o coraçao do assentamento. É capaz de armazenar o máximo de recursos e oferece mais capacidade a cada atualizaçao. Uma vez montado o centro da cidade, os colonos podem se encontrar lá e aumentar sua confiança.
Uma instalaçao médica atende a colonos doentes.
A partir de uma certa idade, uma escola oferece às crianças um lugar para aprender e tornar-se Adultos Educados.
Cabana de um coletor acumula comida de plantas nas florestas.
Uma cabana de pesca fornece comida de peixes capturados, mas só pode ser colocada à beira da água.
Um pomar fornece comida como frutas e nozes das árvores. Embora um pomar possa ser criado sem custos de construçao, ele precisa de tempo para permitir que suas árvores cresçam.
Um pomar coberto fornece comida como frutas e nozes das árvores e pode ser coberto para evitar chuvas tóxicas.
Um campo cultivado fornece comida da lavoura. Embora um campo possa ser criado sem custos de construçao, ele precisa de tempo para cultivar as plantaçoes..
Um Campo Coberto fornece Alimentos da lavoura e pode ser coberto para evitar chuvas tóxicas.
Uma refinaria separa simultaneamente metal, tecido, plástico ou eletrônica de sucata.
O Pátio de sucata coleta sucata das ruínas nas imediaçoes.
Um bar produz cerveja, licor ou junçoes que podem ser consumidas pelos colonos para aumentar sua confiança.
Um alfaiate faz roupas que protegem os colonos contra a radiaçao.
Um workshop produz ferramentas necessárias para qualquer tipo de trabalho.
Uma cabana de ervas reúne ervas em florestas que podem ser usadas para melhorar a saúde dos colonos.
A cabana florestal pode cortar árvores para produzir madeira ou plantar mudas para reflorestar uma determinada área, ou fazer as duas coisas..
Um forno a carvao produz carvao a partir de madeira.

Um coletor de água da chuva coleta a água da chuva sem exigir força de trabalho. Pode ser coberto para evitar a coleta de chuva tóxica. É necessário um Reservatório ou Torre de Água para distribuir a Água dentro do assentamento.
Uma torre de água coleta e armazena água. Também pode usar carvao para filtrar a radiaçao da água. Este edifício requer um molhe, um poço ou um coletor de água da chuva para funcionar.
Um coletor solar gera uma certa quantidade de energia para abastecer o edifício conectado à rede elétrica.
Uma linha de energia conecta edifícios a uma rede elétrica.
Uma bateria armazena energia durante o dia e a retorna à rede elétrica à noite.
Uma fogueira é um local de encontro para os colonos aumentarem sua confiança.
Um lugar para coletar água. Requer um Reservatório ou uma Torre de Água para coletar e armazenar Água.
Um estoque de recursos que podem ser retirados e transferidos para um edifício de armazenamento pelos colonos.
Um poço produz água lentamente e mesmo durante uma seca. Os poços construídos muito próximos têm um impacto negativo em sua respectiva eficiência.
Um Reciclador separa lentamente Metal, Tecido, Plástico ou Eletrônicos da Sucata com baixa eficiência. Somente um desses Recursos pode ser separado por vez.

Um sistema de irrigaçao aumenta a umidade do solo dentro de sua faixa de influência ao longo do tempo. Este processo consome água. O nível de contaminaçao da água utilizada também influencia a radiaçao da terra.

A Estaçao Meteorológica permite que seja tomada a decisao em que nível de contaminaçao da chuva Campos e Coletores de Água da Chuva devem ser cobertos. Além disso, fornece uma previsao de contaminaçao por chuva.

Um Reservatório coleta e armazena Água. Este edifício requer um píer, um poço ou um coletor de água da chuva para funcionar. Nas águas e os poços sao preferidos aos coletores de água da chuva quando a água é coletada.
Realiza tarefas simples e ajuda a transportar recursos.

Os exploradores nao fazem parte da distribuiçao geral de profissoes. Eles podem ser atribuídos e enviados em Expediçoes usando uma Estaçao de Expediçao. Os exploradores nao assumem nenhum trabalho no Acordo.
Escoteiros podem ser enviados para descobrir locais desconhecidos ou produzir raçoes de expediçao na estaçao de expediçao.
Distribui todos os recursos no mercado.
É necessário para curar colonos doentes em uma instalaçao médica.
Reúne plantas como fonte de comida.
Sucata refinada em metal, eletrônica, plástico ou tecido.
Produz cerveja, bebidas destiladas um bar.
Coleta ervas da floresta que ajudam a manter os colonos saudáveis.
Coleta água de poços ou coletores da chuva e a conduz a um reservatório ou torre de água.
As crianças ajudam suas famílias a transportar comida e água para sua casa.
Os alunos aprendem em uma escola. Quando terminam o treinamento educacional, recebem educaçao de adultos e, como resultado, trabalham com mais eficiência.
Os adultos podem se tornar ativos nas profissoes ou ajudar a transportar recursos e realizar tarefas simples.
Cuida dos colonos mortos e dá a seus parentes um lugar para lamentar.
Opera bombas em um poço para garantir um fluxo constante de água.
Fornece água ao sistema de irrigaçao de reservatórios ou torres de água.
Colono visitou o túmulo de um parente.
A casa do colono tem eletricidade.
Colono é casado com um parceiro muito mais velho.
Colono é infértil devido à idade avançada.
O colono é infértil pois foi exposto a um grande nível de radiaçao.
Um parente deste Colono morreu e nao tem sepultura.
A casa do Colono está seriamente danificada.
Colono experimentou algo bom durante uma expediçao.
Ordena que os Colonos reunam toda a Madeira, pequenas Estacas de Sucata e todas as Plantas de uma área. Isso produz menos resultado do que usar os edifícios de produçao específicos.
Ordena que os Colonos coletem toda a madeira de uma área. Isso produz menos resultado do que o uso de uma Cabana florestal.
Ordena que os Colonos coletem pequenas estacas de uma área. Isso produz menos resultado do que usar um Pátio de sucata.
Ordena a todos os colonos nao atribuídos que desenterrem o solo em uma determinada área para remover a radiaçao lá.
Ordena que os colonos colhem plantas da floresta, como frutas, cogumelos ou ervas. Isso produz menos resultado do que usar a cabana de coletor.
Colonos que sofrem de uma doença
Colonos com baixo nível de confiança
Dá a este edifício a maior prioridade para todos os construtores. Eles cuidam da construçao deste edifício assim que concluírem suas tarefas atuais..
Dá a este edifício a maior prioridade para todos os construtores. Eles cuidam de reparar este edifício assim que concluírem suas tarefas atuais.
Nenhuma mudança demográfica desde que os pioneiros se estabeleceram.
Altera o período das estatísticas de produçao e consumo abaixo
Gráficos e estatísticas mais detalhadas sobre colonos e recursos próximosn
Chuva (contaminaçao desconhecida! Construa uma estaçao meteorológica para previsoes)
Os colonos com ferramentas trabalham com mais eficiência. Sem ferramentas, a produçao no assentamento é desacelerada drasticamente.
Os colonos que usam roupas de proteçao nao sao expostos à Radiaçao quando andam por aí. Melhor vestuário de proteçao protege contra níveis mais altos de Radiaçao.
Colonos Educados realizam suas Profissoes com muito mais eficácia do que Colonos Nao Educados.

Recursos que nao podem ser coletados nas imediaçoes:
<<missingResources>>
Nao há força de trabalho disponível. Clique para abrir Disposiçao do Trabalhador ou atribua diretamente a este Edifício.
O limite de produçao deste recurso foi atingido
Nao há construtores disponíveis. Clique para abrir o Menu Profissionais ou atribua diretamente a este edifício.
A capacidade de armazenamento neste edifício está acabando
Faltam recursos para reparar este edifício
Os colonos sao a espinha dorsal do acordo. Enquanto as crianças ajudam seus pais a armazenar mercadorias em suas casas, eles podem assumir tarefas simples de reuniao ou adotar uma profissao..
A soma de todos os buffs positivos que afetam a confiança total.
A soma de todos os buffs negativos que afetam a confiança total.

Your settlement has not survived the hardships of the new world. 

Your Settlers lived for <<years>> Seasons after the Endzone.
The preview version of "Endzone" ends here. Thanks for playing!
Regioes nao expostas a Radiaçao podem ser atravessadas por colonos com segurança.
Regioes expostas a colonizadores de radiaçao de baixo nível lentamente. Eles podem se proteger usando um lenço de pescoço.
As regioes expostas à radiaçao de nível médio contaminam os colonos rapidamente. Eles podem se proteger usando uma máscara de carvao ativado.
As regioes expostas à radiaçao de alto nível sao extremamente perigosas. Colonizadores que nao usam traje de Radiaçao serao rapidamente contaminados.
Solo seco permite que campos, pomares e plantas da floresta murcham.
Solo seco diminui o crescimento de campos, pomares e plantas florestais.
Solo úmido é bom para o campo, pomar e floresta.
Campos, pomares e florestas As plantas crescem mais rapidamente em solo úmido.
Ativar/Desativar Eletricidade para aliviar a rede elétrica conectada
Inventário em estoque de todas logísticas do assentamento

As crianças ajudam suas famílias a transportar Comida e Água para sua casa. 
Próximas crianças a se tornar Adultos:
Confiança média de todos os colonos
Saúde média de todos os colonos
Radiaçao média de todos os colonos
Um baixo nível de confiança diminui o crescimento da populaçao. Colonos podem se animar em Edifícios comunitários.
Um baixo nível de saúde aumenta o risco de surgir uma doença e enfraquece a produçao, porque os colonos afetados se movem mais lentamente.
Um alto nível de Radiaçao permite que a Saúde dos Colonos diminua. Além disso, os colonos se tornam inférteis ou morrem do alto nível de Radiaçao.
Dá a este edifício a maior prioridade para todos os construtores. Eles cuidam da demoliçao deste edifício assim que terminam suas tarefas atuais..
Mostrar ou ocultar o registro do jogo
<<name>> cresceu e se tornou um adulto.
<<name>> terminou a escola e agora é um adulto educado.
e foi substituído por outro Colono.
e nao pôde ser substituído por nenhum outro Colono.
<<name>> teve que abandonar a escola prematuramente e agora é um adulto sem instruçao.
O contador Geiger exibe a Radiaçao média no campo de visao atual.
Clique para exibir a radiaçao terrestre.
O hidrômetro exibe a quantidade de água armazenada em todas as torres de água e coletores de água da chuva do estabelecimento.
Clique para exibir a umidade do solo.
O limite de produçao para Água. Quando o limite de produçao é atingido, todos os Transportadores de Água se juntam para ajudar a executar Tarefas simples no assentamento.
Clique para abrir o menu Recurso
Focalize a construçao anterior deste tipo com a câmera
Focalize a próxima construçao deste tipo com a câmera
A quantidade de recursos reservados para serem recolhidos pelos colonos para consumo ou tarefas de trabalho.
Número atual e máximo de trabalhadores
Número total de trabalhadores nesta profissao no assentamento

Nossos escoteiros descobriram um edifício de aparência interessante em um dos locais abandonados. Nao estava em boas condiçoes. É por isso que devemos levar as ferramentas certas conosco. Talvez algum material de construçao básico também possa ser útil, caso tenhamos que encontrar outra maneira de entrar.

É um edifício bastante degradado - o telhado cedeu parcialmente. Por outro lado, a placa na frente parece uma que tínhamos nas portas da enfermaria médica na zona final. Pode valer a pena dar uma olhada!
Deveríamos tentar encontrar uma maneira de entrar. Talvez encontremos algum material.
Use as ferramentas que trouxemos para entrar pela porta.
Nós forçamos a porta a abrir. Talvez encontremos algo dentro.
Nao encontramos nada. Mas poderíamos tentar novamente em alguns dias.
Vamos tentar subir através do telhado!
Entramos por um buraco no telhado e ninguém ficou ferido! Talvez possamos encontrar algo dentro.
Droga, chefe! Um de nós atravessou o telhado e quebrou uma perna! Mas conseguimos abrir a porta por dentro. Talvez possamos encontrar algo.
Nós encontramos uma maneira de entrar. É hora de pesquisar tudo!
Vamos dar uma olhada na biblioteca!
Encontramos alguns livros interessantes! Talvez possamos aprender algo sobre Medicina com eles.
Talvez possamos encontrar algo se voltarmos com alguém mais inteligente.
Vamos dar uma olhada na mesa de operaçoes!
Encontramos vários tipos de medicamentos e alguns dispositivos eletrônicos! Isso poderia realmente ajudar no caso de uma epidemia.
Talvez possamos encontrar algo se voltarmos com alguém que tenha uma boa compreensao desse assunto..
Talvez encontremos algo se procurarmos nos arredores...
Vamos dar uma olhada no quintal
Encontramos algumas sucatas que podemos usar.
Nao encontramos nada, mas poderíamos tentar novamente outra hora!
Talvez encontremos mais portas dentro da casa.
Encontramos a entrada do porao. A porta estava escondida atrás de videiras.
Nao encontramos outra entrada, mas podemos tentar novamente outra hora.
Talvez encontremos algo no jardim da frente...
Nao encontramos nada, mas podemos tentar novamente outra hora!
Talvez possamos encontrar algo lá embaixo.
Vamos dar uma olhada lá em baixo. Parece que o porao está contaminado.
Tudo correu bem! Encontramos algumas sementes lá em baixo!
Alguns de nós foram contaminados com Radiaçao. Mas nós encontramos algumas sementes lá em baixo!

É uma usina nuclear! Essas coisas devastaram o mundo. Nossos anciaos nos disseram que deveríamos ficar longe deles, mas ainda deve haver Recursos valiosos esperando lá dentro. No mínimo, precisaremos de ferramentas e equipamentos de proteçao para entrar.

Parece quase pacífico, se nao fosse pelo teto desabado. Deve ter sido um grande estrondo! Os remanescentes ainda devem emitir toneladas de radiaçao. Apenas ouça esse contador Geiger! <<dynamicmessage>>
Tem certeza de que devemos passar algum tempo aqui? Todos nós deveríamos usar ternos de Radiaçao se nao quisermos pegar o "sickness".
Podemos tentar subir a porta gigante para arrombar. <<dynamicmessage>> Há uma escada enferrujada até o telhado também. A partir daí, poderíamos tentar entrar na cúpula pelo buraco.
Embora seja difícil abri-lo com nossas próprias maos.
Encontre uma maneira de entrar no núcleo do reator!
Tente forçar a porta a abrir!
A porta nao podia fazer nada para parar o pé de cabra. Agora o contador geiger vai para o beleléu. Você realmente tem certeza disso?
Essa porta pode estar velha, mas ainda nao se mexeu nem um centímetro. <<dynamicmessage>>  Talvez possamos encontrar outra maneira de entrar no núcleo do reator...
Se tivéssemos as ferramentas certas conosco...
Mas você sabe o que, chefe? Nao somos o que você chamaria ágil!

A escada se desfez quando o último de nós estava subindo. Mas nós conseguimos. Agora podemos descer até o núcleo. Você tem certeza disso, certo? O nível de Radiaçao ainda deve ser incrivelmente alto! Podemos ver pedaços de grafite em todo o lugar...
A escada se partiu enquanto subia! Felizmente, ninguém ficou gravemente ferido. Apenas algumas contusoes e um ombro deslocado. O que é pior: nao vamos ficar assim.
Há uma piscina vazia, alguns tubos e máquinas velhas e uma sala cheia de displays e painéis de controle. Mas a agulha no balcao do Geiger continua a piscar...
Parece uma sala de controle. Deveria estar cheio de equipamentos eletrônicos. <<dynamicmessage>>
Sem proteçao, é uma decisao difícil!
This almost looks like the central control room we had back in the Endzone. In any case, we can definitely put all this old technology to good use!
The air had a metallic taste to it, and all of us are already feeling queasy. We grabbed a few loose electronic parts on the way out. We didn't want to leave absolutely empty-handed...
That machine with all those tubes must be a heat exchanger. We can use the Metal it's made of. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!
It took some effort, but in the end we were able to take the whole machine apart. Lots of valuable Metal!
I think this whole place is still highly contaminated, chief. We had to leave quickly, but the first symptoms are already evident.
This airlock should get us into the generator room. The Geiger counter's going off like crazy. <<dynamicmessage>>
Thanks for remembering to pack those suits for us, chief!
Without protection it's a tough call!

We've passed the airlock now. This must have been the generator room before the roof got blown away. All the machinery was destroyed. There's not much left except for wreckage that has to be salvaged. But there are other doors here, too...
That was a bad idea, chief. Some of us are already showing symptoms of the sickness, and we got out of there in a hurry when the Geiger counter started clicking like crazy.

Seems to be all locked-in. There are a couple of roller doors and a side entrance that we could get in through. Our Scout told us it might also be possible to climb up onto the roof and get in from there.
We can try getting in from there! But this symbol is kind of alarming... <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!

Beyond the long corridor we entered the room where the generator must have stood before the roof was torn off. All the machinery was destroyed. There's not much left except for wreckage that has to be salvaged. But there are other doors here, too...
Listen to that Geiger counter, chief! Some of us are getting really scared, and we're not going to leave anyone behind here. <<dynamicmessage>>
We ought to come back with better equipment.
There's supposed to be a storage depot behind those doors. <<dynamicmessage>>
The only drawback is that we don't have any suitable Tools. We'll give it a try, anyway!

It was pretty easy to force the old doors open. Now we're standing in some kind of storage depot - there's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck standing around, and a long corridor leads further inside. Oh, and there's a row of doors at the other end of the hall.

These doors are heavier than they look! We managed to hoist them just far enough so that the skinniest one of us could squeeze through and take a couple of small things from inside. We'd be better off finding a different entrance...
What kind of doors are there?
Okay, the floor collapsed in the middle and there's a row of really sturdy doors on the side of the room.
A collapsed floor that leads to a kind of decontamination room. We could rope some towels together to get down there! <<dynamicmessage>>
If we only had some! But we could still risk it by climbing down.

That was close! The last of us nearly fell on top of the group, but at the last moment he latched onto something. <<dynamicmessage>> There are lots of dusty Radiaçao Suits lying around here! They should prove to come in handy...
Good thing we had a rope.

Damn it, chief, the last of us slipped and fell on top of the whole group. Hit us really hard. We'd be better off heading back... <<dynamicmessage>> This room is full of Radiaçao Suits, but we were only able to take a few of them with us...
Next time, please don't send us down there without a rope.
We should be able to get into the rest of the facility through these doors!
Now we're standing in some kind of storage depot - there's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck in here. Oh, and a row of doors at the other end.
Now we're standing in some kind of Storage Depot. There's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck standing around. Oh, and a row of doors at the other end.
That door might lead further inside... <<dynamicmessage>>
But we need to be careful since we're not very well protected...

This must have been the generator room before the whole roof was torn off. All the machinery has been destroyed. There's not much left to salvage except for wreckage. But there are other doors here, too...

I'm sorry, chief, but we can't go in there. It's a long and dark corridor where the sound of the Geiger counter and the sign on the door constantly remind us what a bad idea this is. <<dynamicmessage>>
If there's no other choice, we could come back properly equipped.
But it could be tough to get in because we don't have the right Tools on hand...
Yes! No door can stop us! We're in a much smaller storage room, but guess what we found in a couple of lockers: Radiaçao Suits and masks! They really ought to come in handy.
We can't do a thing, chief. This door won't budge a bit. <<dynamicmessage>>
If we only had the right Tools along...
We can definitely use the parts. <<dynamicmessage>>
And we've brought along an expert!
<<dynamicmessage>> I'd say we've stripped this thing down completely. That's going to prove to be useful back in camp!
Good thing we have someone with us who knows how to strip down these machines!
Okay, I think we pretty much took along everything we can carry. All that's left are a few big parts that are just too heavy. <<dynamicmessage>>
We simply don't know how we can dismantle them.
Talk about an aging beauty! Time to crank up those old engines!
<<dynamicmessage>> But our Technician did manage to strip the engine down into valuable parts!
Pardon the wise crack. That thing is never going to run again.
Pardon the wise crack. That thing is in good shape, but not good enough by far. We've stripped the truck for parts instead.
It must be a turbine. Except that it's ten times bigger than the one we used to generate power in the Endzone. Just imagine the output alone!
We can try to strip that thing down into individual parts!
Phew, that was a lot of work. We managed to break the thing up, and all the parts are in amazingly good shape!
There's no way we'll be able to take the turbine apart. That thing is heavy and much too large. We'll take some of the other stuff lying around here and head back.
Maybe there's something useful in those barrels.
Some of them seem to contain Água, but the Geiger counter is going crazy! We'd be best off just staying away from those barrels. But we can take the empty ones along with us.

We accidentally tipped one over while trying to open the lid, and now Água has spilled out all over the place. We took off when the Geiger counter started clicking, but some of us suddenly don't feel well at all.
We could climb up onto the roof and get in from there! <<dynamicmessage>>

Climbing up was easy. Climbing down from the hole in the roof was a different story, but we made it. Now we're standing in the generator room. All the machinery has been destroyed. There's not much left to salvage except for wreckage. But there are other doors here, too...

Climbing up was easy. But while climbing down a platform crashed with one of us on it. Although we've made it to the generator room, we've got a broken leg on our hands now, too! There are doors here. We'd be better off trying to get out of here again, chief!
But we're not in the best shape...

As crianças ajudam suas famílias a transportar Comida e Água para sua casa. Eles podem ser educados em uma escola, desde que sejam crianças, para fazê-los crescer e se tornar adultos instruídos..

Os Jovens Adultos são colonos que recentemente se tornaram Adultos e são uma nova força de trabalho em potencial que pode ser distribuída para diferentes profissões. Se eles recebem um local adequado para começar uma família, tentam encontrar um parceiro para aumentar a população do assentamento..

Os adultos são colonos, que podem ter idade suficiente para se provar dignos em uma profissão específica. Nesse caso, eles são recompensados com um emblema. Os adultos ainda são férteis e podem ajudar a aumentar a população do assentamento.
Os idosos não são mais férteis e não podem mais ajudar a aumentar a população do assentamento. É provável que sejam recompensados com um distintivo por uma profissão específica.
Os Adultos Muito Velhos morrerão tão cedo. Se houver Colonos gratuitos disponíveis em caso de sua Morte, eles poderão ser substituídos em sua Profissão atual.

Your Settlers get older and eventually die of old age.
You always have to keep an eye on your Settlers' age to prevent your settlement from dying out.
All Crianças become Adultos as of a certain age. As Adultos they can be instructed to carry out a <link="2"><u>Task</u></link> or to pursue a <link="3"><u>Profession</u></link>.

Settlers who live in a House start a Family. A Family consists of one male and one female Adult. In the course of time these two Settlers are going to reproduce, and if sufficient space is available in the House they have up to three Crianças all at once.

Crianças are born when a Family has enough space in their House. 
They cannot practice <link="3"><u>Professions</u></link> or carry out <link="2"><u>Tasks</u></link>.
Despite this, Crianças are going to help out in the settlement. For instance, they carry Resources from <link="18"><u>Warehouses</u></link> to their homes and attend <link="17"><u>School</u></link> if one is available.

A cabin can be built to give Settlers a home. Settlers constitute a Family when they live in one House. <link="5"><u>Comida Items</u></link> for the Settlers who live there are stored in the Building.
Settlers with a roof over their heads are also <link="8"><u>more confident</u></link>.

The Sturdy House functions like a cabin. In addition it can store more <link="6"><u>Água</u></link> and <link="5"><u>Comida Items</u></link> for its inhabitants, while also withstanding sandtorms more easily. Settlers only move in as a family.

A Shelter has room for up to 25 Settlers. While living in a Shelter Settlers do not start any Families and do not reproduce. The Shelter is able to store <link="5"><u>Comida</u></link> and <link="6"><u>Água</u></link> for its inhabitants.
Settlers who grow too old become infertile. They can also lose their ability to reproduce when they are highly <link="10"><u>contaminated</u></link> with Radiaçao.
For any Building except <link="5"><u>Fields and Orchards</u></link> you must have Builders <link="3"><u>assigned</u></link>.

You can commission the construction of a Building by specifying a construction site on the land where the Building is supposed to appear. If the land does not permit this, it indicates this by marking the problematic areas red. You can place any construction site, even when your settlement does not have the necessary Resources at its disposal yet.
If the land is <link="10"><u>contaminated</u></link> with Radiaçao, your Settlers start by digging up the soil.
Once your settlers have removed the Radiaçao from the construction site, they will bring the Resources needed for construction to the construction site. 
When all necessary Resources are there, your Builders will start constructing the Building.

Many Edifícios have a fixed working radius. <link="3"><u>Employed</u></link> Settlers who work on the Building only work within this assigned radius. You can shift the radius using the appropriate icon.

Entrances to Edifícios are marked as a green area.
Settlers can enter and exit the Building solely at these entrances.

You can rotate any Building by pressing the middle mouse button or the "R" key.
The Building will then be rotated 90° clockwise.

Streets are created differently compared with other Edifícios. Klick on the land where you want to place a Street. Now move the mouse along the route the Street is supposed to take.
Click again to award your Builders the contract to build the Street.
Your Builders begin to dismantle the Streets in the selected area.

<link="5"><u>Fields and Orchards</u></link> are built differently compared with other Edifícios.
Click on the spot of land where you want to create a Field. Now move the mouse until your field has the desired size. Click on the spot again to create the Field.
The minimum size for a Field or an Orchard is 6x6, the maximum size is 16x16.

You can prioritize a construction site by pressing the "Build First" button.
Your Builders will focus on constructing this Building.
Your Builders are going to interrupt the Building's construction process. No Resources are brought to the construction site during a construction pause.
Your Builders stop construction of the Building completely, and all Resources already brought to the construction site are brought back to the Warehouse.

Edifícios become damaged when they have been caught in a <link="7"><u>sandstorm</u></link>.
A Building that has sustained too much damage becomes inactive until it is repaired.
Settlers who have to live in damaged Houses lose some <link="8"><u>Confidence</u></link>. Your Builders automatically repair all damaged Edifícios.
Your Builders can take readily constructed Edifícios apart again. A small part of the Resources used to construct the Building can be used again and is brought to the Warehouse.

Tarefas podem ser usadas para atribuir <link="3"><u>Colonos disponíveis gratuitamente</u></link> reunir Recursos específicos ou remover Radiaçao em uma determinada área. Somente colonos que nao realizam<link="3"><u>qualquer atividade</u></link>realizará essas tarefas. A única exceçao a isso é a tarefa "Remover Radiaçao".
Até 4 colonos podem trabalhar em uma única tarefa.
Os colonos começam a reunir <link="15"><u>Madeira</u></link> de <link="15"><u>árvores</u></link>localizado dentro do <link="3"><u>área de trabalho ativa</u></link>.

Os colonos começam a coletar <link="15"><u>Sucata</u></link> from <link="15"><u>Pilhas de Sucata</u></link> localizado dentro da <link="3"> <u> área de trabalho ativa </u> </link>. No entanto, eles nao podem coletar nenhum recado de <link="15"> <u> grandes ruínas </u> </link>. Para que eles façam isso, você deve <link="3"><u> atribuir</u> </link> eles como <link="15"> <u> Coletores de Sucata</u></link>.
Os colonos começam a se reunir <link="5"> <u> frutas, cogumelos </u> </link> e <link="9"> <u> Ervas </u> </ link > localizado dentro da <link="3"> <u> área de trabalho ativa</u></link>.
Os colonos começam a reunir todos os Recursos localizados nas <link="3"><u>active working area</u></link>.

Os colonos começam a remover<link="10"><u>Radiaçao pollution</u></link> by digging up the soil. 
Unlike other Tasks, here you don’t need <link="3"><u>freely available Settlers</u></link>. All Settlers who have nothing to do at the moment, even those who have a Workplace, will help dig.
Os colonos param de remover<link="10"><u>Radiaçao</u></link> from the selected area.
Ajustando colonos trabalhando em um edifício
Você nao pode empregar um colono diretamente. Em vez disso, você especifica quantos Colonos devem praticar uma determinada Profissao. Os colonos sao automaticamente distribuídos entre as profissoes.
Você pode ajustar manualmente o número de colonos empregados que trabalham em um local de trabalho específico até o máximo permitido para cada tipo de construçao.

Os colonos que nao receberam nenhuma Profissao nao permanecem ociosos. 
Por exemplo, eles transportam Recursos para <link="1"> <u> locais de construçao </u> </link> e dentro de Armazéns. 
 Eles também carregam todas as <link="2"><u> Tarefas</u> </link> que você as der. 
Se um Colono com uma Profissao designada morrer, essa Profissao será automaticamente emitida para um Colono disponível gratuitamente.

Colonos alocados trabalham na Profissao que lhes foi atribuída. 
Eles nao realizarao quaisquer <link="2"><u> Tarefas</u> </link> criadas separadamente. 
 Se por algum motivo elas forem incapazes de executar seu trabalho, eles nao ficarao ociosos. 
Eles começarao a levar Recursos para os <link="1"> <u> canteiros de obras </u> </link> e para os Armazéns. Além disso, eles também removem Radiaçao das áreas de trabalho ativas da tarefa <link="2"> <u> Remover Radiaçao </u> </link>.

Os colonos precisam de Comida para sobreviver. Se nao receberem comida suficiente, passam fome e morrem. Quanto mais <link="9"> <u> fontes de Comida </u> </link> disponíveis, melhor. Se os colonos estao com fome e a comida está disponível, eles cuidam da nutriçao de maneira autônoma..

As plantas da floresta crescem perto de <link="15"><u> árvores</u> </link>. Eles regridem quando o <link="7"> <u> Nível de Irrigaçao </u> </link> é suficiente. Na mesma linha, eles murcham quando o solo está muito seco. 
Eles podem ser coletados através dos respectivos <link="2"><u> Tarefas</u> </link> ou pelos Gatherers.

The Gatherer's Cabin <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Gatherers. Gatherers pick Mushrooms and Berries that lie within <link="1"><u>their working radius</u></link>. Gatherers work more efficiently when the Gatherer's Cabin is <link="1"><u>placed</u></link> in the vicinity of <link="15"><u>trees</u></link>.

Wild Game roams the map in herds. It can be hunted by Hunters.
Wild Game needs time to reproduce, and overhunting will impair the speed of reproduction.

The Hunting Lodge <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Hunters. Hunters hunt wild animals in their <link="1"><u>working area</u></link>. Pay attention to roaming herds and adapt the working area to achieve an optimum yield.

The Fishing Hut <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Fishermen. The Fishermen catch fish from <link="6"><u>Lakes</u></link>.
A Fishing Hut must be <link="1"><u>placed</u></link> next to a suitable source of Água. Any source of Água that is big enough to accommodate the Fishing Hut is sufficient.
Placing many Fishing Huts next to each other reduces their productivity. Therefore try to keep them outside the <link="1"><u>working areas</u></link> of neighboring Fishing Huts.

There are many different Seeds with which Fields can be planted and Orchards can be sown.
All of the Plants have their own individual Growing Times and Yields.
Plants grow faster when the <link="7"><u>Irrigaçao Level</u></link> is sufficiently high.
If the soil dries out, the Plants dry up too and die.
Employ Farmers to sow the Seeds and bring in the Crops.

Fields <link="3"><u>employ</u></link> Farmers. Farmers plant and harvest Crops when they’re ready to be harvested. To order the Farmers to plant a Seed, choose the Seed via the "Change Seed" button.
You can also put a different Seed on the waiting list. The Farmers begin by cultivating the new Seed as soon as the current Crop has been harvested. To plant the new Seeds immediately you can force the Farmers to harvest the current Crop in the Field by pressing on the "Harvest Atual Crop" button.

Orchards operate similarly to Fields and <link="3"><u>employ</u></link> Farmers.
Unlike Crops in field cultivation, Seeds from Orchards spawn Fruit or Nut Trees.
These trees have an initial Growing Time which they need in order to yield a Crop. Once an Orchard tree has grown it will provide Comida each Estaçao.
Your Farmers can bring in Harvests from these trees for several Seasons before they have to be replanted.

Settlers require Água to survive. If they are not supplied with enough Água they die of thirst. The more sources of Água available to them, the better. When Settlers get thirsty and Água is available, they will take care of their nutrition themselves.

The Reservatório <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Água Carriers. These Água Carriers collect Água from all available sources of Água within the active <link="1"><u>working area</u></link>. One Reservatório can <link="18"><u>store</u></link> up to 2000 units of Água. You can manually indicate from which sources the Reservatórios ought to collect Água.

The Água Tower works similarly to the Reservatórios and represents an upgrade. A single Água Tower can <link="18"><u>store</u></link> up to 5000 units of Água. The maximum number of Água Carriers is accordingly higher. In addition, the Água Tower has a filtration system to filter out the Radiaçao from <link="10"><u>contaminated água</u></link> using <link="11"><u>Charcoal</u></link>.

Lakes are the primary source of Água for your settlement. They equally give you access to Fish. Build a Jetty to be able to collect Água and a <link="5"><u>Fishing Hut</u></link> to be able to fish.
You should also keep an eye on the Lake's <link="10"><u>Radiaçao Level</u></link> because Água Carriers collect Água contaminated with Radiaçao, too. All Lakes dry up temporarily during a <link="7"><u>drought</u></link>. This source of Água runs dry as a result.
The Jetty creates a point from which your Água Carriers can collect Água from a Lake.

Wells <link="3"><u>employ</u></link> Wellkeepers. Wellkeepers pump groundwater into a retention basin.
This Água can subsequently be collected by Água Carriers and brought to Água Towers or Reservatórios. 
Placing multiple Wells next to each other reduces their productivity. Therefore try to place them outside neighboring <link="1"><u>working areas</u></link>.

The Rainwater Collector collects Água from <link="7"><u>rain clouds</u></link>. This Água is subsequently picked up by Água Carriers and brought to a Água Tower or a Reservatório. Keep an eye on the rain clouds' <link="10"><u>Radiaçao Level</u></link> because the Rainwater Collector also stores rain contaminated by Radiaçao. To prevent this you can <link="7"><u>temporarily cover Rainwater Collectors</u></link> that belong to you.
The weather influences the lives of your Settlers to a great extent. You should constantly check which kind of weather awaits your settlement in the coming Seasons and prepare yourself appropriately.
During the night all production Edifícios work at a slower pace. If they are supposed to work more efficiently you have to supply them with <link="13"><u>Electricity</u></link>.

Rain clouds move across the map and increase the Irrigaçao Level of the soil they pass over. Some of these clouds may even contain acid. Rain not contaminated with Radiaçao will also decrease the <link="10"><u>Radiaçao Level</u></link> of the soil.

The Irrigaçao Level indicates the <link="6"><u>Água Level</u></link> of the soil. The more Água stored in the soil, the faster Plants like <link="5"><u>Berries, Mushrooms and Seedlings</u></link> grow on it. If the soil is dried out, the Plants wither away and die, too.
You can check soil moisture by switching on the Água Heat Map.

Contaminated rain increases the <link="10"><u>Radiaçao Level</u></link> in the soil. There are three kinds of contaminated rain. Each type of rain pushes the Radiaçao Level to its respective value. Acid rain increases the Irrigaçao Level of the soil just like normal rain.

During a drought the soil dries out and <link="5"><u>Plants as well as Seedlings</u></link> wither away.
All <link="6"><u>Lakes</u></link> dry up at the same time. Água returns to the Lakes at the end of a drought.

Some droughts are accompanied by a sandstorm. The sandstorm influences the <link="10"><u>Radiaçao Level</u></link> of the soil. Settlers caught in a sandstorm move slower. 
Any Building hit by a sandstorm will also be <link="1"><u>damaged</u></link> and (if not repaired) eventually become unusable.

The Weather Station enables you to see if rain clouds are contaminated with Radiaçao or not.
If they are contaminated, you see how strong their Radiaçao Level is, too.
Here you can also set at which point your <link="5"><u>Fields and Orchards</u></link> as well as your <link="6"><u>Rainwater Collectors</u></link> ought to be covered so that they are spared from contaminated rain.

The Irrigaçao Plant <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Irrigators. 
The Irrigator transports Água from the <link="6"><u>Água Tower</u></link> or the Reservatório to the Plant System.
Once activated, the Plant System increases the Irrigaçao Level of the soil in the <link="1"><u>working area</u></link>.
The higher the Irrigaçao Level is supposed to be, the more Água is going to be consumed during Irrigaçao. During a drought the Irrigaçao Plant System consumes even more Água.
If the Água is contaminated with Radiaçao, the <link="10"><u>Radiaçao Level</u></link> in the Plant System working area increases as well.
In turn, Água not contaminated with Radiaçao reduces the Radiaçao Level.

Many different factors influence the Confidence of your Settlers. Discontented Settlers need longer <link="4"><u>to multiply</u></link>.
In the case of Settlers whose Health status is low, in other words poor, the walking speed will be reduced.
Settlers can visit a Campfire and spend some time there to temporarily boost their Confidence.

The Cemetery <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Morticians. Morticians gather up dead Settlers located within their <link="1"><u>assigned working area</u></link>. The dead Settlers are buried at the Cemetery when enough graves exist. Graves are usable again over the course of time. 
If a Settler has a dead relative who is not lying in a grave, he/she receives a debuff to his/her Confidence. Settlers can also visit their relatives' graves to temporarily boost their Confidence.

Liquor can be made by a Pubkeeper out of <link="5"><u>Berries</u></link> and <link="6"><u>Água</u></link>. Consuming it not only provides a temporary boost to Settlers' Confidence, it also reduces <link="6"><u>thirst</u></link>.

Beer can be made by an Pubkeeper out of <link="6"><u>Água</u></link> and <link="5"><u>Wheat</u></link>.
Consuming it not only provides a temporary boost to Settlers' Confidence, it also reduces <link="6"><u>thirst</u></link>.

Hemp can be planted on <link="5"><u>Fields</u></link> and behaves just like any other Seedling.
Later on it can be used to make Joints.
Joints can made by an Pubkeeper out of Hemp.

The Pub <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> an Pubkeeper. Pubkeepers produce Beer, Liquor or Joints out of different ingredients. Each Pubkeeper is only able to make one of these recipes at a time.

Which recipe is to supposed to be prepared next can be set. The employed Pubkeeper begins with the work on the new recipe as soon as the current Task is completed.
Settlers can visit the Tavern. If they are provided with Beer, Liquor or Joints, they get a temporary boost to their Confidence.

Health is crucial for the survival of your Settlers.
When the Settlers' Health status is poor and Herbs or Medicine are available, they take care of healthcare themselves. Providing a large amount of different <link="5"><u>Comida sources</u></link> keeps your Settlers healthy. <link="10"><u>High-level Radiaçao</u></link>  diminishes your Settlers' Health. In the case of Settlers with low-level Health, they move slower and run a greater risk of getting sick.

Herbs grow near <link="15"><u>trees</u></link>. They regrow when the <link="7"><u>Irrigaçao Level</u></link> of the soil is sufficiently high. In turn, when the soil is arid they wither. They can be gathered either via the <link="2"><u>Gather Plants Task</u></link> or by Herbalists.

The Herbal Hut <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Herbalists. Herbalists gather Herbs located within their <link="1"><u>assigned working area</u></link>. Herbalists work more efficiently when the Herbal Hut lies in the vicinity of some <link="15"><u>trees</u></link>.

Medicine is made by medical doctors out of Herbs.
It increases your Settlers' Health far more effectively than Herbs.

The Medical Facility <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Medics.
It stores Herbs and processes them into Medicine.
If an Illness breaks out in your settlement, Settlers go to the nearest Medical Facility to receive treatment, provided that sufficient space exists at the Facility.

An Illness might break out in your settlement from time to time.
Settlers infected with such an illness go to the nearest Medical Facility for treatment. If they are not treated, an illness can cause the death of your Settlers.
The possibility exists for Settlers to infect other Settlers while passing by them.

Radiaçao is one of the most prominent dangers your settlement is exposed to.
You ought to avoid exposing your Settlers to High-level Radiaçao.
Radiation exists at different levels. These levels range from No Radiaçao to High-level Radiaçao.
Low-level Radiaçao is generally depicted in green, Medium-level Radiaçao in yellow, and High-level Radiaçao in red. The higher the level of Radiaçao, the more dangerous it is.
You can view the current level of Terrestrial Radiaçao by toggling the Radiaçao Heat Map. This enables you to keep an eye on your surroundings and you can try to avoid highly contaminated areas.

When Settlers are exposed to Radiaçao from any source, their individual Radiaçao Exposure Level rises.
In the case of higher-level Radiaçao, the Settlers' <link="9"><u>Health</u></link> declines much faster, making them more susceptible to <link="9"><u>Illness</u></link>. If a Settler's Radiaçao Exposure Level rises too high, the Settler eventually becomes infertile and can even die from the Radiaçao.

Comida Items that are harvested from soil contaminated with Radiaçao will be contaminated by it.
If your Settlers consume such <link="5"><u>Comida Items</u></link>, their Radiaçao Exposure Level will rise.

<link="6"><u>Água</u></link> collected from a Lake or a Rainwater Collector containing Água contaminated with Radiaçao will be contaminated, too. If your Settlers consume these kinds of Água, their Radiaçao Exposure Level will rise.

Your Settlers need clothing to protect themselves from omnipresent <link="10"><u>Radiaçao</u></link>.
When Settlers have no protective clothing and clothing is available, they equip themselves on their own. Better clothing protects against higher-level Radiaçao.
Protective clothing is durable yet becomes unusable over time.
When a piece of clothing becomes unusable, the Settler needs a new one.

Neck Scarves completely protect your Settlers against <link="10"><u>Low-level Radiaçao</u></link>. Neck Scarves also provide a slight amount of protection against higher-level Radiaçao, but they do not shield against it completely. They are made by Tailors and require <link="16"><u>Cloth</u></link>.

Activated Carbon Masks completely protect your Settlers from <link="10"><u>Low- and Medium-level Radiaçao</u></link>. Activated Carbon Masks also provide a slight amount of protection against higher-level Radiaçao, but they do not shield against it completely. They are made by Tailors and require <link="16"><u>Cloth</u></link> and Charcoal.

Radiaçao Suits completely protect your Settlers against <link="10"><u>Low-, Medium- and High-level Radiaçao</u></link>. They are made by Tailors and require <link="16"><u>Cloth</u></link>, Charcoal and <link="16"><u>Plastic</u></link>.

The Tailor's Shop <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Tailors. Tailors make Neck Scarves, Activated Carbon Masks and Radiaçao Suits out of <link="16"><u>Cloth</u></link>, Charcoal and <link="16"><u>Plastic</u></link>. You can decide which remedy is supposed to be produced next. The employed Tailors begin with the work on the new remedy as soon as the current Task is completed.

Charcoal is produced by the Charcoal Burner. <link="15"><u>Madeira</u></link> is needed to produce it.
Charcoal can be used to make protective clothing or to filter the Água stored in your <link="6"><u>Água Towers</u></link>.
The Charcoal Kiln <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Charcoal Burners. Charcoal Burners make Charcoal out of <link="15"><u>Madeira</u></link>.
At your Town Center you can decide which kind of protective clothing will be issued to your Settlers. Your Settlers only take protective clothing with them up to the ranking you have chosen.

Tools help your Settlers in the course of all the Tasks they take on.
When Settlers have no Tools and no Tools are available, they equip themselves on their own.
Settlers who own Tools produce more Resources with each Task.
They can also increase the chance of an Expedition's success.
Tools lose durability each time they are used. When a Tool has no durability anymore, the Settler needs a new one.
Scrap Tools increase the produciton speed in the case of Tasks where the Settler is equipped with them. Scrap tools are made in the Workshop out of <link="15"><u>Madeira and Scrap</u></link>.

Metal Tools substantially increase the production speed in the case of Tasks where the Settler is equipped with them. Metal Tools are made in the Workshop out of <link="15"><u>Madeira, Scrap</u></link> and <link="16"><u>Metal</u></link>.

The Workshop <link="1"><u>employs</u></link> Technicians. Technicians make Scrap Tools and Metal Tools out of <link="15"><u>Madeira, Scrap</u></link> and <link="16"><u>Metal</u></link>. You can decide which type is supposed to be produced next. The employed Technician begins with the work on the new type as soon as the current Task is completed.

You can supply your Edifícios with Electricity by hooking them up to a Power Grid.
In the case of Edifícios that are connected to the Power Grid,  the working hours decrease during <link="7"><u>daytime as well as nighttime</u></link>. Each Building that is supplied with Electricity consumes a certain amount of the total Power Supply for as long as it is connected.

You can manually enable or disable the Power Consumption of any Building hooked up to the Power Grid. When sufficient Electricity is not available, the Power Grid will be deactivated until enough energy is available again. When a House is hooked up to the Power Grid and Electricity is flowing, the inhabitants additionally get a boost to their <link="8"><u>Confidence</u></link>.

The Solar Collector generates Electricity during the <link="7"><u>day</u></link>.
No energy is generated at night.
A Battery can store surplus Electricity until it is fully charged. At <link="7"><u>night</u></link> this Electricity is used to supply all connected Edifícios with energy until the Battery is empty.
Power Lines connect Edifícios to the Power Grid.

Some of the older Ruins in your region could still contain valuable Resources like <link="16"><u>Plastic, Metal</u></link> or similar items. You might also find <link="5"><u>new Seeds for your Fields and Orchards</u></link> among those Resources. In order to search for valuable things hidden in the Ruins you have to send an Expedition to them. But before you can send an Expedition you have to scout out the site first. Once you have found everything of value inside the Ruin, your <link="15"><u>Scrap Collectors</u></link> can <link="15"><u>strip the Ruins</u></link> just like normal ones.

You can send Scouts to certain Ruins to unlock them for future Expeditions.
A Scout will visit the Ruin and then return with more precise information about it.
This information also includes the types of Advantages that might be helpful during the Expedition.

As soon as you have scouted out a Ruin you can send some of your Settlers on an Expedition.
You must individually specify which Settlers you want to send on an Expedition. Keep the Advantages in mind and provide your Settlers with sufficient Rations for their Expedition.

Advantages hold sway over your Expedition's prospects for success. These Advantages can vary a great deal and each Ruin has its own individual Advantages. Your Scouts will give you information about which Advantages are helpful for the Expedition.

Sending Settlers off on an Expedition takes place together with Rations. These Rations consist of <link="6"><u>Água</u></link> and <link="5"><u>Comida</u></link>.
All of your Explorers need Rations so that their needs can be taken into account during the journey to the Ruin. Each time they complete a Task during an Expedition they will also use up a Ration.

The Expedition Station <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Scouts. Scouts produce Rations. You can also send them to scout out Ruins. Expeditions are started from an Expedition Station, too. You can only build one Expedition Station in your settlement.

Scrap is one of the key Resources for your settlement.
Many Edifícios require Scrap in order to be <link="1"><u>built</u></link>. It is also needed to obtain <link="16"><u>refined Resources</u></link> such as <link="16"><u>Cloth</u></link> and <link="16"><u>Plastic</u></link>, and to make <link="12"><u>Tools</u></link>.

Scrap Piles contain a varying amount of Scrap, depending on their size.
Scrap Piles can be amassed either via the <link="2"><u>Gather Up Scrap Task</u></link> or by Scrap Collectors.
Scrap Ruins contain larger amounts of Scrap. They can only be taken apart by Scrap Collectors.

The Scrapyard <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Scrap Collectors. Scrap Collectors collect the Scrap located within their <link="1"><u>assigned working area</u></link>. Scrap Collectors work more efficiently when the Scrapyard <link="1"><u> is placed in the vicinity of several Scrap Piles or Scrap Ruins.

Madeira is one of the key Resources for your settlement.
Many Edifícios require Madeira for their <link="1"><u>construction</u></link>. It is also needed to make <link="11"><u>Charcoal</u></link> and for making <link="12"><u>Tools</u></link>.

Trees grow everywhere on the Map. Depending on their size and age, they supply a certain amount of Madeira.
They can be chopped down, either with the help of the <link="2"><u>Gather Madeira Task</u></link> or by Foresters.
If the <link="7"><u>Irrigaçao Level</u></link> is sufficient, <link="1"><u>Mushrooms and Berries</u></link> begin to grow near them.
Foresters can reforest cleared areas.

The Forester Lodge <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Foresters. Foresters collect Madeira located within their <link="1#2"><u>assigned working area</u></link>. Foresters work more efficiently when the Forester Lodger is erected in the vicinity of some <link="15"><u>trees</u></link>. Foresters can equally plant new trees. The Forester Lodge can be set so that it chops down or plants trees, or performs both at the same time.

Many Edifícios require refined Resources for their <link="1"><u>construction</u></link>.
Formulas for products like <link="1"><u>protective clothing</u></link> or <link="12"><u>Metal Tools</u></link> are needed, too.
These Resources are manufactured from <link="15"><u>Scrap</u></link>.

Cloth is used in the <link="1"><u>construction</u></link> of certain Edifícios such as the <link="11"><u>Tailor's Shop</u></link> or the <link="4"><u>Shelter</u></link>.
It is also a crucial component of the <link="11"><u>protective clothing</u></link> your Tailors are able to make.

Metal is used in the <link="1"><u>construction</u></link> of certain Edifícios such as the <link="12"><u>Expedition Station</u></link> or the <link="12"><u>Workshop</u></link>.
It is also a crucial component for making <link="12"><u>Metal Tools</u></link>.

Plastic is used in the <link="1"><u>construction</u></link> of certain Edifícios such as <link="6"><u>Rainwater Collectors</u></link> or the <link="7"><u>Irrigaçao Plant System</u></link>.
It is also a crucial component of <link="11"><u>Activated Carbon Masks and Radiaçao Suits</u></link>.
Electronics are used above all in the <link="1"><u>construction</u></link> of <link="13"><u>Electricity Edifícios</u></link> or special Edifícios such as the <link="9"><u>Medical Facility</u></link>.

The Recycler <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Refiners. Recyclers produce refined Resources from <link="15"><u>Scrap</u></link>.
Each Refiner can only produce one of these resources at a time. 
You can set which Resource is supposed to be produced next. The employed Refiner begins with the work on the new Resource as soon as the current Task is completed.

The Refinery functions in a way similar to the Recycler and equally <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Refiners.
Unlike the Recycler, a Refinery produces all refined Resources simultaneously. It cycles each Resource through automatically.
The Refinery is also able to deploy a much larger number of Refiners and needs less time to produce each individual Resource.

Educated Settlers complete every Task assigned to them faster than Uneducated Settlers.
Educated Settlers are also able to utilize their <link="12"><u>Tools</u></link> and <link="11"><u>protective clothing</u></link> more effectively.
Their Tools and protective clothing last twice as long. 
The more settlers who are educated, the more efficiently your settlement will function. To be regarded as educated, the settler must have gone to school during his/her Criançahood.
The School <link="3"><u>employs</u></link> Teachers. As long as sufficient space is available and a Teacher is present, Crianças will attend school and get educated.

Each Resource must be stored so that it can be redistributed by your Settlers.
Settlers stockpile Resources automatically when sufficient storage area exists.
Each Resource has an individual weight and therefore uses up varying amounts of the Stockpile.

Not all Edifícios can store every Resource. Most Edifícios can only store the Resources they produce or need for their own production. Settlers bring and take these Resources into or out of the Building on their own.

Settlers have their own inventory. Each settler is only able to collect Resources when his/her inventory space has not reached its capacity yet. There is no limit to how many different Resources a Settler can bring along with them as long as his/her capacity has not been reached yet.

You can set a Production Limit for each Resource. Your settlement stops producing a certain Resource when the Production Limit is reached. As soon as the Resource quantity has fallen below the Production Limit, your Settlers will start production again.
The Town Center can store any Resource except <link="6"><u>Água</u></link>. You can choose the types of Resources that ought to be stored in the Town Center and change your decision at any time.
A Warehouse can store any Resource except <link="6"><u>Água</u></link>. You can choose the types of Resources that ought to be stored in the Warehouse and change your decision at any time.

The Market employs Logistics Specialists. Logistics Specialists gather Resources from all Warehouses and bring them to the Market. The Market also has a Depot for <link="6"><u>Água</u></link>. Settlers who visit the Market get a temporary boost to their <link="8"><u>Confidence</u></link>.You can choose the types of Resources that are supposed to be stored at the Market and change your decision at any time.

A Greenhouse! We saw pictures of them in the Endzone. Just picture all the Plants and Fruits that must have grown here... sadly, there's not much left of them. The only things lying around here are rusty Metal and Scrap. We could send an Expedition to excavate the ground. Maybe they'll find something.
Well, just like our Scout reported: Metal and rubble. Should we be on the lookout for anything specific, or just grab the Scrap and get out of here in a hurry?
It doesn't look like much, but we'll keep our eyes open.
If anything from the time before the incident survived, then we ought to find it underground. But it's been a long time... We'll have to be really thorough. <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time maybe we'll have to bring along an agriculture expert.
We'll take a look around. Maybe we'll find something in one of the dusty corners. <<dynamicmessage>>
If you had only packed a few of the right Tools for us...
There are Herbs growing here that we can use for Medicine!
I don't know what you expected here, chief, but the only things here are grass, filth and dirt. Just like everywhere else. <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time we ought to bring Tools along!
Chief, we found a new type of Seed for our Fields! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our agriculture expert just discovered it. That's precisely why it's so important to hire the right people!
We've torn apart whole piles of rubble and still haven't found anything remarkable yet. We'll just take some of this Scrap with us... <<dynamicmessage>>
Next time we ought to bring someone along who knows more than a thing or two about Plants.

Judging by that big green cross and the helipad, this must have been a hospital where they treated their sick and wounded. Unlike them, we won't have the luxury to get painkillers for a broken ankle anytime soon, right? Wait, can painkillers stay intact for a whole century? Hmm. If this place wasn't already looted, this thing could be a gold mine...

Looks like the Scout was right, chief! One part of the Building has partially collapsed, but even from a distance you can see that this structure is nearly untouched! On the other hand, some fresh footprints lead to the main entrance, and we also discovered a few spatters of blood...

The footprints lead directly toward the main entrance. Unfortunately, we can't look through the windows because they're all coated with layers of dirt. We could try to open the main door or break in through one of the windows. <<dynamicmessage>>
Opening the door shouldn't be too hard since we brought along some Tools.
We should've brought along some Tools for that door, just in case it was locked.
Smashing these windows shouldn't be hard, chief! We just need to make sure no one gets hurt. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we have a veteran with us.
I told ya we'd get in with ease! <<dynamicmessage>> Really looks like some loner set up camp here. The spot where he built his fire is still warm!
Our veteran smashed in the window with one rock at a safe distance! Smart cookie.
Ahhhh, bad news. One of us got cut really badly. We’ll make a bandage out of some rags lying around here. I just hope there won't be an infection. I think it would be wise to head back...
This door is sturdier than it looks… I'd say it was blocked from the inside with a big chunk of Madeira. Presumably by the person who got here before us. <<dynamicmessage>>
Lucky for us you packed up an axe, chief!
An axe would've done the job... But we've still got our hands...
That door is a done deal! Really looks like some loner set up camp here. The spot where he built his fire is still warm! We're inside now. From here we can reach the main corridor!
This door won't let itself be opened so easily. This person really made sure that no one gets in without an effort. At least not here... We might need to find another way...
We made it to the main corridor. It's pretty dark in here, but we discovered signs that designate different departments and wards we can take a look at.
We can head to the Storage Department to see if we can find any Medicine left. <<dynamicmessage>> I bet we'll find protective clothing, too!
While reading our guide we learned that some medication never expires...
If we hadn't skipped school, maybe we'd know if some of this stuff is still usable...
Yeah, some of those painkillers last forever! Good thing our Survival Guide told us about that... We also found some respirator masks that must have been stockpiled again after the incident.

Well, we found a huge pile of Medicine, but it was way past the expiration date for it. I don't think it's safe to use that stuff. On the bright side, we just found some Activated Carbon Masks inside some lockers.
On the way to the executive suite. This must be where all those doctors took their breaks. We’ll probably find some books to read here.<<dynamicmessage>>
Our veteran tells us we ought to be thorough. It's a sure bet those privileged doctors hid their best stuff in their offices.
I'm not sure if that's our best option, but most likely it’ll just be books. Nothing else.

Our veteran had us search every corner, but it was really worth it! We found some old whiskey! What a haul! We found a stock of well-preserved painkillers and lots of interesting books, too. Even got our hands on some novels!
Just as predicted, there were all sorts of books left over. We even got our hands on some novels! We've already taken a look at a few of them. We'll have enough time to read some on our way back!
The footprints lead in this direction... <<dynamicmessage>>
Our doc tells us that, judging by the strange movement pattern, it looks like this person is limping. Pretty sharp guy, that doc.

Looks like this guy headed to the Trauma Center to get some bandages. He was also bleeding severely and probably used some rags to stop the bleeding, but apparently that didn't help much. <<dynamicmessage>> We'll head further inside.
The doc says we ought to hurry, his wounds seem to be really bad.
We found him! That guy must've got hit pretty bad. His heartbeat is weak and he's unconscious. <<dynamicmessage>>
The doc says a wild boar did a real job on him.
We'll need some serious skill to get that guy shipshape again. <<dynamicmessage>>
Luckily we have our doc on our crew.
At least we brought some Medicine along.

He's back in the land of the living! He'll hook up with our group. <<dynamicmessage>> The poor guy told us he used to be a Scout in a different Endzone and took off after a reconnaissance mission. That was 15 years ago. Can you believe it? Said he couldn't stand the dark hellhole anymore. He still had some Rations left and shared them with us.
Doc truly performed a miracle in there!

The poor guy ran out of luck! We tried our best, but there was too much blood loss and inflamed tissue. We brought him to the morgue so that at least the wild animals don't get to him. He still had some Rations left in his backpack, but some were soaked in blood and we couldn't take all of them with us.
We can lay him down on a nearby operating table. There should be some alcohol on hand to sterilize his wounds and patch him up! But we need to hurry! <<dynamicmessage>>

He's back in the land of the living! He'll hook up with our group. <<dynamicmessage>> The poor guy told us he used to be a Scout in a different Endzone and took off after a reconnaissance mission. That was 15 years ago. Can you believe it? Said he couldn't stand the dark hellhole anymore. He still had some Rations left and shared them with us.

A whole section of the building seems to have broken off and collapsed. Did an earthquake cause this? Either way, this could be an easy access to the first floor. From there we can get to all the different levels via the adjacent stairwell.
The floor is higher than we thought. Maybe it's not so easy to get up there, after all. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing you packed rough-and-ready Tools for us. We'll have a better grip on that old concrete while climbing up.
Good thing you packed some Cloth for us. This way we can fashion ourselves a rope!
Good thing you packed some Cloth and a pick for us. This way we can build ourselves a grappling hook!
Some Cloth or a Tool really could've helped us here...
We just reached the first floor, chief. <<dynamicmessage>>
Getting here was a breeze! Finally working with real pros, at last!
Some of us nearly hit the ground. This old concrete has really turned into pudding.
Damn it, chief, this concrete is much too brittle. One of us fell just before we reached the first floor. It's really hard to get a grip. Good thing it was only the first floor, so no major injuries.
We made it to the first floor. If we use the adjacent stairwell we'll have no trouble reaching all the floors of this Building. Just like we predicted.

We could go down to the ground level, chief. I just don't know why you wanted us to climb up to the first floor then, but what do I know. The stairs are also partially collapsed. Getting down will be easy but getting back up this way won't be possible.
If you say so. Guys, the chief wants us to go back down! Yeah, I know...
There's a large bookshelf and a bunch of different cabinets here on this floor. Plenty of stuff to comb through. <<dynamicmessage>>
This must be the administrative wing. I bet they have some kind of strongroom with a safe.
Having someone with more imagination might have helped to find the truly interesting stuff.

On the first try, chief! We found a hidden door that leads to a small storage compartment. There were lots of Radiaçao Suits and some well-preserved Medicine! Good thing some of us enjoy reading adventure stories...
Well, what a waste of time. We found a few books to read. But still, far more interesting than our Survival Guide... It bores you to tears! We'll bring them back to Camp!
The sign next to the stairs tells us that this floor is intended for patients' rooms. There's supposed to be plenty of Scrap and Metal here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Our Technician just had the bright idea to stop by the janitor's room and grab some Tools so that we can dismantle things faster!
A Technician could've helped out with the dismantling, but we'll manage anyways.
Yeah. We took those beds apart in nothing flat! We also found a few good Tools and a stack of cables! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we had a Technician on the team. Saved a lot of time!
Taking those beds apart took longer than we thought. But still, a lot of Metal emerged in the process.

This must be one of the Greenhouses that people used for farming. Man, life must have been much more carefree back then. The Greenhouse itself is in bad shape, but there's a variety of Plants growing here that we haven't seen anywhere else.
We've arrived at the Greenhouse, chief. I don't know what that Scout told ya... to us, it just looks like any other Ruin scattered around in the wilderness. Not very promising...

Let's see, some Plants are growing where the Planting Area must have been when this was still a lush green oasis. There's also an old ventilation shaft that we could dismantle for Scrap. <<dynamicmessage>>
A Farmer or a Gatherer could've really helped us out here!
Some sort of Corn grows here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Sadly, we don't know much about Plants at all.
Good thing we brought along an expert!
The Plants growing here only vaguely resemble the Corn we know<<dynamicmessage>>! We could gather them and try to cultivate them.
. The exposure to Radiaçao must have altered their phenotype
These Plants are of no use to us... <<dynamicmessage>>. We'll just collect some Scrap instead.
Maybe these Plants used to have Seeds way back when, but the exposure to Radiaçao must have rendered them sterile. Which makes me wonder how they reproduce...
We could remove the cover of this old shaft. Not much to expect here, chief! But you never know. <<dynamicmessage>>
Wait, our expert tells us it would make a good refuge for some edible Mushrooms. All right, I get it...
Maybe a Gatherer would know better...
Yeah, we found what looks like some sort of Mushroom. We'll scrape them off carefully! <<dynamicmessage>>
I was told it deals with some kind of moss with fungi. Our Gatherer is sure it's edible. He already took a bite.
Well, it's an empty old shaft... We'll take it apart so that at least we end up with some Metal out of this venture.

The remnants of an old Greenhouse. People used to grow Fruits and Vegetables there before the incident. There are quite a few of them around. Hmm. Looks like some of our ancestors cared about Mother Nature, after all. You can send some Explorers to take a closer look. Maybe they'll dig up something useful.

We're here, chief. There's not much to look at. Shattered glass here and there, rubble, and an old Metal frame. Was that Scout pulling our leg, sending us here all because of this junk heap?! Then let's get to work.
Stop arguing and take a look at that!
Let's see... all sorts of smashed pots, planters and buckets. This thing seems to have had a ventilation system, too. Which is now rusty and falling apart. So, how should I put it?... Scrap.
We'll try to take along some of this stuff. Don't want to see that it was all for nothing. <<dynamicmessage>>
At least we have a genuine craftsman with us.
If we had brought along a good foreman, everything would've been simpler.
All right, not anything remarkable, but we still managed to get some Scrap and Metal out of this place.
Well, there's not much left we can still put to use, but it's still better than nothing. <<dynamicmessage>>
I mean, this all looks like garbage to us. Maybe we ought to bring somebody along who's in a better position to distinguish garbage from recyclable.
It deals with some sort of dilapidated ventilation system. Looks like some parts of it could still be put to good use. <<dynamicmessage>>

No, no way! While taking the ventilation apart we noticed that this thing had a false bottom! And guess what was inside, chief? Vacuum-sealed and just waiting for us to find? A plastic container full of hemp that someone must've stashed here! Let's consider this a gift from the past and get ready for a laid-back evening in the Tavern! Hate to say it, but good thing that Scout led us here.
Some Metal and a few old Plastic parts… I'd say that's all there is, chief. Like I said, that Scout is a jerk!
The remnants of an old Greenhouse. There are still some Plants growing inside. Maybe we'll get lucky with this one!
Okay, we're here. The Scout didn't tell us a thing, but there's a sweet smell lingering in the air here. It gets even stronger the closer you get to the Greenhouse.

The smell seems to come from a bunch of Plants growing in the middle of the Ruin. They have long thin leaves; spiked, almost jagged-looking. I'd say they were once cultivated here and somehow managed to survive the fallout.
Wait a second. This must be Marijuana! The sweet smell, the leaves... it all fits! We can harvest these babies! <<dynamicmessage>>
It's a sure thing a Farmer would have some comments to offer...
Lucky for us, we have a Farmer on the team.
We could leave the Plants where they are for now and try to salvage part of the Metal the Greenhouse is made of. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along some Tools for us. Would've been a lot more efficient.
Good thing we brought along our tools!
If we're careful we can take the blossoming little Plants with us and try to cultivate them back at the Camp! <<dynamicmessage>>
Can you believe these dimwits, chief? They nearly would've destroyed these precious little creatures by ripping them out of the ground.

If we only knew how we'd be able to cultivate this godsend... maybe next time we ought to bring along one of the experienced Farmers. But who cares, anyway? Get ready to fly high as a kite in the bus once we get back, chief!
Alrighty, looks good. This is almost more usable Scrap and Metal than we can carry!
Good, we got some Scrap out of this thing. Although the frame itself is too sturdy. <<dynamicmessage>>
We'd need some tools to take it apart.

Our Scout said that our ancestors used this Ruin to debug stories. Maybe we should do that, too. (If you see this story and you're not a developer, please report this by pressing F1 using our STOMT tool)
