Privacy Policy for the Game “Endzone” I. General Information

1. Body Responsible; Company Data Protection Officer In the following we explain to you which personal data are collected and processed by us when our services or offers are used. We are: ASSEMBLE Entertainment GmbH  Georg-August-Zinn-Strasse 2 65183 Wiesbaden, Germany  Telephone: +49 611 13 57 82 30 eMAIL: info@assemble-entertainment.com Personal data are individual details regarding personal or factual circumstances pertaining to a specific or identifiable natural person.

2. Legal Basis We collect and process personal data based on the legal grounds stated in the following: \u2022 Consent pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (a) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Consent is any voluntary expression of intent given in an informed and unequivocal manner in the form of a statement or other unambiguous confirmatory act which indicates that the data subject consents to the processing of his/her personal data. \u2022 Necessity to fulfill the contract or carry out preparatory actions pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (b) of the GDPR. This means that the data are required so that we are able to fulfill the contractual obligations to you or we need the data to prepare a contract closure with you. \u2022 Processing to fulfill legal obligations pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (c) of the GDPR. This means that a processing of the data is stipulated, e.g. due to a law or other regulations. \u2022 Processing toward the safeguarding of legitimate interests pursuant to Article 6 para. 1 (f) of the GDPR. This means that processing is necessary to safeguard legitimate interests on our part or those of third parties insofar as the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms on your part which require the protection of personal data do not predominate.

3. Rights of the Data Subject You are entitled to the following rights with regard to the processing of data by us in the scope pursuant to the respectively listed articles of the General Data Protection Regulation: \u2022 Right of access to the data pursuant to Art. 15 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to rectification pursuant to Art. 16 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to erasure ("Right to be forgotten") pursuant to Art. 17 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to restriction of processing pursuant to Art. 18 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to data portability pursuant to Art. 20 of the GDPR \u2022 Right to object pursuant to Art. 21 of the GDPR Without prejudice to any other administrative or judicial remedy, you have the right to complain to a supervisory authority, in particular in the member state of your place of residence, employment or the place of the alleged infringement, if you believe that the processing of the personal data affecting you violates the GDPR.

4. Data Deletion and Retention Period The personal data of the data subject shall be deleted or blocked as soon as the purpose of storage ceases to apply. Above and beyond this, storage may occur when this has been envisaged by the European or national legislator in directives, legislation or other regulations pertaining to EU law which the processor is governed by. A blocking or deletion of the data also occurs when a retention period prescribed by the standards stated expires unless a necessity for further storage of the data for conclusion of a contract or fulfillment of a contract exists.

a) Scope of Data Processing The game provides the possibility to make contact with us via Stomt in the event of problems, errors or wishes for improvement. Stomt is a service of the firm Stomt GmbH based in Germany. By making contact a query is posted on a public Community Board hosted and operated by Stomt GmbH. Among other options, registered users can reply there as well. However, the message can also be composed in such a way that it is posted anonymously. An email address and a user name can but do not have to be made available. The same applies for a screenshot of the respective game scene in which the problem arises. If you use this service, Stomt processes the posted data on its own behalf and under its own responsibility on the basis of its privacy policy at https://www.stomt.com/privacy. Besides this data, which we have no influence upon, we receive technical data intended to help us in solving any technical issues. Insofar as an email address is indicated, we receive the following data together with said email address and the user name indicated: \u2022 Screen Resolution \u2022 Version of the game \u2022 Information whether the gamer is in an ongoing game or in the main menu \u2022 Details about the existing hardware and operation system, including drivers \u2022 Time elapsed, in seconds, since the game was started \u2022 Replay – data that contains the game moves made until now \u2022 Logfile of the game with possible error warnings, including the following data: \u2022 IP adress of the local network (not the Internet IP) \u2022 Computer name \u2022 Unity version \u2022 A text file containing all information about the game map created by the gamer and all starting options selected This data is stored at Stomt and made availble to us and/or software developers commissioned by us. The software developer commissioned by us shall reply to customer queries via email or on the Stomt platform. In the event of a reply via email, the entire follow-up email correspondence shall be saved.

b) Legal Basis The legal basis for the processing of the data by us is Art. 6 para. 1 (b), (f) of the GDPR. The basis for the processing by Stomt on its own behalf for those data published by Stomt is the Usage Agreement between you and Stomt. The data are collected directly by Stomt, however the transmission of data to Stomt occurs only when you actively send a “Stomt” message. Data that are not published are processed by Stomt on our behalf pursuant to Art. 28 para 3 of the GDPR. The legitimate interest within the meaning of Art. 6 para 1 (f) of the GDPR therefore lies in the functionality of our game and the customer service for customers with whom we maintain no direct contractual relationship. The developer of software commissioned by us processes support queries on our behalf pursuant to Art. 28 para. 3 of the GDPR, and solely within the European Union. In addition, the legitimate interest for email storage here is that we want to monitor the customer service provided by our developer in terms of its quality.

c) Purpose of data processing The purpose of data processing is to render support services toward customers along with the continuous improvement of our game and correction of errors within said game.

d) Retention Period To the extent that no direct support for a customer is supposed to be performed, the email address and user name shall be deleted without undue delay. The remaining data shall be subsequently used anonymously. To the extent that support services are being rendered, the data are saved for the duration of the customer dialog and subsequently for the term of any warranty. If no case involving warranty exists, the data are retained for 6 (six) months in the event that the customer has further questions.

e) Objection and Removal Option The acquisition of data is urgently necessary for the rendering of support services. Although the customer can object to a use of his/her data at any time via email to support@assembleteam.com, in such case a rendering of support services is no longer possible. Insofar as the services take place within the framework of statutory warranty legislation, an objection is not possible.
Privacy Policy for our Feedback Reporter

Here's a Building with a weird sign on the front facade. It's not exactly in the best shape. The boys should bring along Tools and a Doctor. Aside from that, some strange flyers are lying around in the neighborhood houses: "Moonshine for the end of the world". Was that some kind of party? There's a bottle in the center with the inscription "XXX" printed on it. Oh, well, sorry for taking up your time, chief...

It's a pretty run-down Building - the roof has partially collapsed. Although, the sign in front looks like the one we had on the doors in the medical ward back in Endzone. Could be worth taking a look inside. <<dynamicmessage>>
I'm not sure why the Pubkeeper had to come along. I think it'd be better to have a freshly tapped Ale await us when we return...
I bet there could still be Medicine and other useful stuff lying around here! The door looks solid. We could also try getting in through the roof... <<dynamicmessage>>
Clear yourselves a path to get in there!
Good thing we've got some sturdy Tools with us!
We can try to jimmy the door open, but it might be hard without good Tools...
Looks accessible, although I wonder if that roof can still hold the weight with one of us on it....
We can try it through the front door. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought some tools along, just in case.
Good thing you packed up some Tools for us!
Okay, we've jimmied the door and are standing in what looks like a waiting area. Lots and lots of stools.
There's no way we're getting in <<dynamicmessage>> there!
We ought to be able to get in by climbing onto the roof <<dynamicmessage>>.
, although it'd definitely be easier for someone younger
, for once it's an exciting challenge
We simply jumped through a hole in the roof. Doesn't get any easier than that, chief! Now we're standing in some kind of waiting area. Lots and lots of stools.
Damn it, chief, one of us broke broke a leg! But at least we're inside now! We're standing in some kind of waiting area. Lots and lots of stools.

There are two rooms here and a stairway down to the basement, except that the stairs are blocked by the rubble from the collapsed roof. One room must be where the patients were treated, the other just seems to be full of files. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we brought along someone who can make head or tail out of all these files!

Too bad we don't have anyone with us who has a grip on this medical stuff and can make head or tail out of all of it. Although, we could just look and see if we can find a manual with a catchy title...
No doubt there's useful things like bandages and stuff like that here! For sure! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we brought along the doc! Now we know what the pills and syringes lying around here are good for!
Although, we're pretty much in the dark as to what this stuff here is. We should've brought along our doc.
Guess nothing's been looted here yet since the incident! Here's a Medicine cabinet filled with all sorts of pills, bandages and syringes. Everything still looks intact. We'll take it all with us!

Guess nothing's been looted here yet since the incident! Here's a Medicine cabinet filled with all sorts of pills, bandages and syringes. We're not familiar with the stuff... but we packed up a few things, anyway. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along the doc.
Let's go through all those files and books! There's a whole bunch of stuff lying around here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Someone who can read better would've been helpful.
But luckily we can read quite well.

They're just old files - barely readable anymore and full of useless information about the little aches and pains people used to have. If the only problem we had was a stiff neck... what a life... But at least we found a wide-ranging medical book. Looks promising! Helpful! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we have our very own mister smarty pants with us. Wouldn't have spotted it otherwise between all these files!

They were all just old files - barely readable anymore and full of irrelevant information that didn't get us anywhere. <<dynamicmessage>> In the end, merely one book with the promising title "A Quack Doctor's Guide for Dummies"! Think that'll get us somewhere, chief?
We should've brought along someone who's educated!
Maybe we'll find something out here! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our veteran told us that lots of these old Houses often have a basement where you can get in from outside.
But I'm not sure what you're hoping to find here, chief. And we're not exactly the most experienced crew...
Roger, we'll take a look at the backyard. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along a veteran. To us, this area looks... pretty uninteresting...
Ah, our veteran already went ahead. Looks like we already spotted something...
Look what we found! <<dynamicmessage>> Looks like a hatch to the basement. Everything's all overgrown here and hidden behind thick vines, but we can squeeze through...
Our veteran is a walking secret door detector!
Well, it's an empty backyard, chief. We did find some Scrap, but that's about it. <<dynamicmessage>>
If we come back with one of our veterans, maybe we'll be luckier here...
We can take along a bit of the Scrap lying around. Not particularly interesting, but better than nothing.
Not exactly our biggest find, but as the old saying goes: "A little Scrap a day and the suit’s on the way". Not funny? Okay...
Oh, we got a little distracted. What were we supposed to do? Right, gather up some Scrap...
Looks as if the good doctor got a kick out of making moonshine on the sly! It's a full-scale distillery down here: pots, bottles, ... Whatever’s needed seems to be here!
Then hurry up and get down there!
Let's take a closer look at this baby! Still looks as if it's in good shape. We could tidy this thing up and brew our own liquor! But, it could be dangerous...<<dynamicmessage>>
Damn, we don't have our Pubkeeper with us... That thing would be running again in no time. We'll try it anyway.
You should've seen the look on our Pubkeeper's face. That was good instinct to take him along, chief!
Sweet, it's up and running! It'll take some time till the alcohol's ready, but good things are worth waiting for, right? <<dynamicmessage>>
Not to mention that we don't want to go blind from cheap hooch.

Okay! That went just like in a textbook! Hmmm, smells pretty awful, but ... whatever, I'll take a slug. *Coughs* What the blazes is this crap? Guys, don't drink this stuff! Everything's gotten all blurry. Shoot, chief, that wasn't a good idea...

The shelves are full of bottles - there's still liquid in some of them! Ah, the bottle with the "XXX" the Scout was talking about... they brewed strong stuff down here while the world was going down the drain. Nice! <<dynamicmessage>>
We just don't know which ones are still properly sealed, hmmm. We should've brought along that Pubkeeper.
Our best friend, the Pubkeeper, has already hurried to the shelves to sort the bottles!
Now that's a stroke of luck! Most of these bottles were empty or all gunked up, but a few of them were still properly sealed! The finest moonshine - get ready to party hearty!

No idea what we had in mind by taking a slug from those old bottles. That was a pretty bad idea... the headaches we got are murder! At any rate, there's nothing we should take along. The moment we feel better we'll just take some Scrap and split!

Caro Sobrevivente,

Hey chief, one of the Scouts here. I went to the coordinates you suggested and came across an old Storage Depot. Pretty run-down, walls are missing, rust everywhere - a downright Ruin. Looks like there's an old shipping container inside. If you're thinking of sending an Expedition here, it might just be worth it.
We're at the location now. Like that Scout said - a dilapidated Storage Depot. At least we should be able to get a little Scrap out of this place. But who knows? Maybe we'll get lucky today.
So, there's the old shipping container the Scout mentioned. Locked up <<dynamicmessage>>
but that shouldn't be any problem since we brought along some Tools.
and we didn't bring any Tools. But it's old and rusty, so maybe we can just force it open.

A reminder of human hubris. The people before us built these plants to ensure cheap energy, not caring about risk or taking long-term impacts into consideration. When it all spiraled out of control, these things brought death to millions. Almost two centuries later and it still emits Radiaçao. Better send a properly equipped Expedition if you don't want to risk adding to this thing's body count, chief.
This place gives us the creeps - it's eerily quiet except for the clicking of our Geiger counter. <<dynamicmessage>>
We really shouldn't be here, chief. Like our Scout said: it's too dangerous without protection.

We managed to climb up a giant door and get in from there! Now we're standing in a control room, with the actual core beneath us. It's embedded in a pool of Água and, judging from the Geiger counter, still emitting Radiaçao like crazy...
We can take as much of the equipment in here as we can carry!
A real treasure trove, chief! This should provide more than enough electronic parts for a while...
We've dismantled a few of these devices, but our heads are starting to spin. I think the sickness is getting to us - time to head out of here, chief!
Could be dangerous, but maybe we'll find something useful down there.

We were pulling some of the tubes and machinery out of the pool when one of us slipped and fell in the água! Even though we did manage to pull him out quickly, we'd still better watch if he displays any signs of the sickness. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we're all wearing Radiaçao Suits.

We were pulling some of the tubes and machinery out of the pool when one of us slipped and fell in the água! We managed to pull him out quickly but he lost consciousness. We're worried sick, it must've been a pretty heavy dose of Radiaçao! This one's on you, chief- why would you send us here without the right equipment?
Seems to be all locked up. There are a couple of roller doors we could try to force open <<dynamicmessage>>, but we could also try getting in through that collapsed roof our Scout told us about.
with the Tools we brought along
, though that could be difficult without any Tools
Getting to the roof should be easy, there are ladders leading up
Alright, we've climbed up to the roof and reached the upper floor through the collapsed part.
We should be able to pry them open. <<dynamicmessage>>
We didn't take all these Tools along for nothing, after all.
It was easy enough to force those old doors. There's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck in here. We'll start sorting through it and take what we can put to use back home with us.
These doors are heavier and sturdier than they look! <<dynamicmessage>>
No way we'll get them open without some Tools.
There are a lot of desks and a locked room at the end of the corridor. Unfortunately there seems to be no way down from here - the stairway is buried under slabs of concrete from that collapsed roof.
Bet we can find some useful stuff if we look around! Besides some office supplies there are even some old computers here. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe our Technician can dismantle some of them!
A Technician could help us dismantle some of them!
Well, it's a lot of useless rubble - old pens, books, coffee cups and squeaky desk chairs. But we can salvage some of it for Plastic and Metal! <<dynamicmessage>>
Our Technician even managed to grab the last electronics from the computers that was still working.
We even managed to grab some electronics from the computers without a Technician.
Well, it's a lot of useless rubble - old pens, books, coffee cups and squeaky desk chairs. But we can salvage some of it for Plastic and Metal! <<dynamicmessage>>
A Technician could've gotten something else out of these old computers.

Ha! We knew this would be worthwhile, chief! They've stored a couple of Radiaçao Suits and Activated Carbon Masks in this room. They'll come in handy when we have to deal with areas contaminated with Radiaçao!
It's no use, chief. The door is made of solid metal and won't budge an inch. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we ought to come back with some Tools, but we shouldn't spend too much time here.
I guess we could keep going at it for hours, but we really shouldn't spend too much time here, not with the Radiaçao and whatever else...
Looks like they used this Building to house the turbine! We can try to dismantle it. It ought to bring some valuable metal! <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we brought along some Tools and someone who knows about this technical stuff. Otherwise this would be one pointless venture...
But without the right Tools and someone who knows about this technical stuff, we won't be able to take this thing apart...
It's a good thing we have someone along who knows about this technical stuff. Too bad we don't have the right Tools with us. But we can still try.
It's a good thing we have the right Tools with us. Too bad we don't have someone along who knows about this technical stuff. But we can still try.
We'll try our best to take this thing apart.
Phew, that was a lot of work. We managed to dismantle it and still keep all the pieces in good condition!
No way we'll manage to take this thing apart - it's simply too big and too heavy. But we can still come back <<dynamicmessage>> and try again.
with someone who knows about that technical stuff
with better equipment and someone who knows about that technical stuff
Way to go, chief! It'll be smooth sailing from here!
What a pain. Next time we'll get it right!
We really stepped on the gas to crank that number up. But now you've got to keep an eye out that our kids and us stay healthy, okay?
Nope, chief. You know that "increasing a population" is more work than cranking up a number, right?
*humming* How much madeira could a woodchuck chuck. If a woodchuck could chuck madeira? As much madeira as a woodchuck could chuck, If a woodchuck could chuck madeira.
Gee, chief, we really don't need that much Madeira. Was that some kind of contest?
If there's one thing we love, it's rummaging through endless mounds of garbage. Nothing beats it!
We do love these mounds of garbage, but that turned out to be a bit too much.
Each button for Map Markers generates a marker on the Minimap at the current camera position that helps you return to this position quickly and at any time.
Good thing we brought along the right Tools.
Looks sturdy. Could be hard to get in with our bare hands...

Aaand, it's open! <<dynamicmessage>> The container is filled with crates full of "authentic folk costumes" - at least that's what's written on the label. From the look of them they were probably produced on the other side of the planet and then shipped here to be sold for a song.
Easy as pie when you bring along the right Tools. Can't tell you how much I've come to love my trusty crowbar, chief!
It's old and rusty, but we're still having a hard time forcing this container open, chief!
We should come back with better Tools.
We'll strip whatever's still any good for Scrap.
Well, let's see. Some old crates made of Metal, some wooden palettes, a few pieces of Plastic, some junk. All in all, it's not much, but at least we won't leave this place empty-handed.

This must be an old gas station. If we hadn't settled already this might have brought our bus some more miles. I can't imagine there's still much left to find here, but it might still be worth it to send an Expedition to take a closer look. At least there ought to be some salvageable stuff  in it.

We're here, chief. Well, that Scout pretty much summed it up already - not much left here. The station is in pretty bad shape - the structures look like they're made of rust instead of Metal. But we'll look around anyway.
Well, the gas pumps are either gone or busted, but there's a garage we could check out. The convenience shop, too. Our best bets, I guess.
Most likely we'll find some old Tools inside along with some sheets of Metal. Judging by the size of the garage, they also did some repairs here back then. <<dynamicmessage>>
That roller door looks really sturdy. A crowbar would've helped.
Good thing we brought along a crowbar!

The door's open. Looks like an old military truck. They must have been in a real hurry, everything's scattered around. The truck's pretty much stripped and a bunch of Tools are lying around. A welcome discovery!
Damn. We won't be getting in <<dynamicmessage>>, chief. Guess we could come back better equipped!
We'll check out that shop! But to be honest, most of the stuff is probably way past any expiration date or has simply become unusable after all these years. <<dynamicmessage>>
A Scrap Collector would've helped finding the stuff that's still usable.
Good thing we brought along a Scrap Collector to sort out the stuff that's still usable.

We found a skeleton in the midst of a pile of old whiskey and beer bottles, with empty Comida cans lying all around next to some sooty walls. The poor guy must've spent his last days here drinking and waiting for the inevitable. Guess only a lucky few made it to an Endzone. We'll take what's left in here and let those bones rest in peace.

We found a skeleton amidst a pile of old whiskey and beer bottles, with empty Comida cans all around next to some sooty walls. That poor sod must have spent his last days here drinking and waiting for the inevitable. Guess only a lucky few made it to an Endzone. <<dynamicmessage>>
It's horrifying to search with this skeleton watching, plus there is not much of use left.
It's horrifying to search with this skeleton watching, we'll take some stuff and leave.

Chief - I think I came across the entrance to another Endzone. The Elders mentioned there were other Endzones nearby, but apparently we lost contact with them long ago when communication systems broke down after the incident. The main gate still seems to be sealed shut, so if you want to send an Expedition, make sure they bring along the right Tools and folks who know about all this technical stuff!

We're here, chief. This looks almost exactly like the Endzone we left behind to start anew. Can you still remember the tingling of sunlight on your face when we first opened that airlock and stepped outside? For a moment there everything seemed so bright and promising...
Anyway, a thought just crossed my mind - maybe there are other survivors down there, people like us! Let's hurry up and get that main gate open so we can find out!

Well, I'd say we have two options: We can try to open the airlock just enough so that we can squeeze through. Or we can try fiddling around with the panel box that controls the airlock. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without a Technician or some Metal Tools, both options will be tough.
Opening up the main gate should be easy using our Metal Tools.
Good thing we brought along a Technician.
Let's give that big main gate a shot! We probably won't be able to open it all the way.
Phew! It took some work, but we managed to pry it open so that we can get through now!
Phew! Sorry, chief, but there's no way we're going to force our way in like this. This giant thing was built to last!
Absolutely pointless - we have no idea what to do with that box.

Ha! We need more of these technician guys, chief! After fiddling around with the box for a while, there was a bang - apparently we short-circuited the thing! The main door opened up just enough so that we might squeeze through.

Ouch! I got an electric shock while fiddling around with this thing. Absolutely no idea what I'm supposed to do with all these breakers, circuits and whatever all this stuff is called. We could come back and bring a Technician along!

Well, we had to climb down the elevator shaft. Looks like the elevator is broken, though that's probably not the only thing not working down here. Lights are flickering, dirt everywhere, and stale air. What a letdown. Can't imagine anyone still lives here.
Apart from that, it looks similar to our Endzone with a different floor layout. The hydroponics station should be on this level. Second sublevel ought to be a living area and medical ward, third sublevel machinery and storage. Looks like all the other floors caved in. Damn it!
Not sure if we really want to find out what awaits us on the second sublevel, but let's see...
I think there are footprints on the stairs going down, chief. Though it's hard to tell in this dim light. Might be from when people were still living here.
Judging by that stench it must be in bad shape, but let's take a look. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along people with more knowledge about Plants and such.
Our Gatherer tells us we shouldn't give up hope. The stench doesn't mean it's a lost cause!

Oh my god, it smells awful in here. The Água in the tanks is slimey and filled with algae, and the few Plants that are left are rotting away. No wonder, since only a few of the grow lights are still working, and the água pumps seem dead. <<dynamicmessage>>

On closer inspection, one of our experts noticed that these algae might be edible, and there are some Mushrooms growing on a pile of compost. Almost looks like someone was still tending to this place; living on shrooms and green jelly. Can you imagine, chief?

Oh my god, it smells awful in here. The Água in the tanks is slimey and filled with algae, and the few Plants that are left are rotting away. No wonder, since only a few of the grow lights are still working, and the água pumps seem to have broken down. Let's get out of here.
Hm, the door down to the third sublevel seems locked. <<dynamicmessage>> We could also check out the medical ward or head down the corridor to the living area.
How does it look like on the second sublevel?
We can try breaking it down without tools, doesn't look too sturdy.
Shouldn't pose any problem to force it open with our trusty Metal Tools. I'm talking crowbar, chief.
Let's check what's left on this floor. There should still be some heavy machinery around. <<dynamicmessage>>
Good thing we have some handy tools!
With Metal Tools this would've been easier.

Oh my god *retching sound* - a blast of disgustingly foul air hit us when we broke the door down. As we went down further it became harder and harder to breathe. We held our breath and went on, only to find decaying corpses in the machine room. They stored their dead down there. What a tragedy...
I guess we'd need some proper Tools to break this door down, chief. Won't get anywhere like this.
Hopefully there are some medical supplies left. <<dynamicmessage>>
We brought our doc along. Should be easy to tell which supplies are still usable.
If we'd brought our doc along it'd be easier to tell good from bad.

I just had the strangest dejà vu - felt like I've been in this exact same place before. Probably because it's so similar to our old Endzone... Guess they already used up most of their supplies, but we scraped together some remnants and Cloth. <<dynamicmessage>>
Our doc even identified some old compounds and liquids that we thought were garbage...

I just had the strangest dejà vu - felt like I've been in this exact same place before. Probably because it's so similar to our old Endzone... Guess they already used up most of their supplies, but we scraped together some remnants and Cloth.
No way! I think I just heard faint voices from those living quarters!

You won't believe this, chief- we found survivors! Their diet was based on Mushrooms and algae, but their supplies were running low. Listen for yourself, I'll get their leader on the radio: *female voice* Hello, can you hear me? My name is Charlotte. What a relief your people found us! Everything went south when our systems started shutting down a couple of months ago - the ventilation, the electricity, our hydroponics culture system... We got ready to leave the Endzone, but the main gate wouldn't budge and we didn't have any able-bodied Technicians left. *sobbing* It didn't take long before people were starving and gave up hope altogether... you guys are true saviors! The real thing!

It's me, chief, one of your Scouts. Came across a House with a strange symbol on it - two snakes intertwined on a stick with wings. Think I saw that once in one of the medical manuals we had back in the Endzone. The House is run-down, but there might still be some medical supplies left in there that we could really use back at Camp!

We arrived at the location, chief. The House must've been an old medical practice. I can imagine that people before us already scoured this place, but we'll check anyway. At least it'll be easy to get inside - the door's not locked.
So, how does it look inside?
We're standing in the doorway now - there's a stairway to the upper floor, and these must've been a waiting room and treatment room down here.
We could take a look at the upper floor. <<dynamicmessage>>
Should've brought along a good Scrap Collector.
Good thing we brought along a good Scrap Collector!

That doc must've lived right over his office. Everything's pretty much in ruins up here. Someone else must've already been here before us. Nothing left but rubble - Ahhh, wait a sec! A few old dirty sheets, at least <<dynamicmessage>>!
, spotted by one of our hard-core Scrap Collectors
That doc must've lived right over his office. Everything's pretty much in ruins up here. Someone else must've already been here before us. Nothing left but rubble and dirt. <<dynamicmessage>>
You'd have to be a hard-core Scrap Collector to find anything in this mess, chief.
Let's take a look around those rooms. <<dynamicmessage>>
We should've brought along our doc.
Good thing we brought along our doc.
It would've helped to have someone who's educated sort through this stuff.
Good thing we have mister smarty pants with us!

I'd say someone must've already combed through all the desks and cabinets in here. There's just some old patient files left - we can probably learn something from them! And we'll strip some of the furniture for Scrap. Otherwise that's pretty much it on this floor. But we did find a stairway down to the basement in the back!

I'd say someone must've already combed through all the desks and cabinets in here. There's just some old patient files left <<dynamicmessage>>. And we'll strip some of the furniture for Scrap. Otherwise that's pretty much it on this floor. But we did find a stairway down to the basement in the back!
- really boring stuff, except for doctors or smarty pants
There's a Metal door at the end of the stairs. We'll try to force it open <<dynamicmessage>>
but it'll be hard without any of the right Tools.
We'll try our best to bust that thing open!

Oh my god. Well, the door's open now - but it wasn't locked to hide valuables. There are hospital beds lined up all along the walls here, with a skeleton on each and every one of them. Just lying there, hands folded - looks almost peaceful. In the back of the room there's a skeleton sitting at a desk, a grimy white doctor's coat still on its shoulders and its fingers wrapped around a syringe. Guess they must've chosen death over the fate that awaited them after the incident. We ...could scavenge the bodies, chief, but we won't feel too good about it.
Damn, that door won't budge. Whoever installed and barred this thing must have wanted to make sure no one would ever open it again... <<dynamicmessage>>
D'ya think maybe we ought to come back with the right Tools, chief?

Hey chief, remember what we learned in the Endzone: Basic needs come first! We have to build up a Água supply, to be able to stock up some água. Place and build a Reservatório near a lake and your town center to establish a storage for água.

Since we now have a Reservatório, we can stock up água. But as the warning icon above the Reservatório indicates, there is a água source building missing to complete a functioning água supply. Consider that the Reservatório itself has a radius (AOE), in which every possible água source can be placed.
